children.subject:
Not sure about others, I lost a good night sleep thinking about it, but reckon it's well worth it when the light finally came on.  I suspect DP problems are not the only subject in this class I will see in my sleep.

Maybe someone with more coding background or mathematical mind can prove (the correctness of) an algorithm in their head without actually testing/running it (on a computer), but I actually had to code the algorithm (in C) to prove it works as I envisioned.  The difference between coming up an idea and actually implementing /coding it is details, lots of details like initial state, boundary checks and corner cases, that, if improperly implemented, could result in false positives or false negatives of the correctness of the algorithm.  Testing with actual codes helped me gaining a deeper understanding of how/why an algorithm works than I could grasp by watching a video on the concept.  Maybe someday I could play out the algorithm in my head more accurately and thoroughly without feeling the need for testing it on a computer, but I've got a long way to get there.

Dude I totally couldnt sleep cuz i kept looping through the DP problems in my head, trying to "solve" them while simultaniously trying to fall asleep! Thinking about DP is not a good relaxation technique, actually causes a mess of anexity and discomfort :)
Do students ever tell you they see DP problems in their sleep?

history.content:
First a request:  please don't distribute the [DPV] solutions I provide.

When (if?) I teach this class in the future I will give them to the

students so there is no need to pass it to your friends.  

More importantly, there are many classes

that use this book and you'll enable cheating if they become available (yes,

I realize they are probably out there already, but I'd hate to

be a part of it).

I've posted to TSquare solutions to some more DP problems.

Once again, I suggest only looking after you believe you successfully 

solved them.  

DP takes a lot of practice to master.  So go find some other practice problems

on the web if you need additional practice, and maybe post some good ones

you find.  By the way, students often tell me they see DP problems in their 

technical interviews. 

--Eric
history.subject: DP Practice Problem Solutions
